ceacdb8c93e0e84e1920√ó1080 132 KB

i have seen may of these pictures.

i didn‚Äôt rant this one, but maybe this a good place to.

what is the alternative for android and ios?

ios and macs are totally controlled by apple. android is too much controlled by alphabet inc, including android open source project. i want new o.s. for mobile devices, which is actually open and transparent, not just the source code, also development, app store and management. also ability to install apps without centralized control or app store, basically sideloading by users.

i quite often here i say:
sometimes it is more important to secure underlying operating system than getting perfect communication protocol.

originally this wasn‚Äôt Fediverse related. the first post on the topic, at least that i could find, was ‚Äúnational switch day‚Äù from WhatsApp to Signal. the fediverse actually joined later.

zetabeta:

what is the alternative for android and ios?

GrapheneOS

GrapheneOS: the private and secure mobile OS

GrapheneOS is a security and privacy focused mobile OS with Android app compatibility.

link_counts.title: GrapheneOS: the private and secure mobile OS

posts.cooked:
CueHD:
zetabeta:

what is the alternative for android and ios?

https://grapheneos.org/

sometimes i say:
android is abuse of linux.

i start to be convinced that actual alternative comes outside of android world, that includes android open source project.

okay, let‚Äôs play this route.

f-droid is better than aurora store. because aurora still uses google‚Äôs servers. so, aurora fixes privacy issues.

but f-droid still uses android. even though that privacy and data collection issues are fixed in ungoogled android, android api android android is still dependent on google‚Äôs development. in short: there still little bit google in it.

grapheneos has fixed many of the google‚Äôs problems, but it is still android based, and some indirect dependence on google.

maybe i should add, no android based either.

i don‚Äôt like to blame graphenos here in general sense, they have done good job for fixing many things in android, but everything they cannot fix. also they use google‚Äôs hardware pixel phones.

link_counts.title: /e/OS - e Foundation - deGoogled unGoogled smartphone operating systems and online services - your data is your data

posts.cooked:
rassilon1963:

there‚Äôs also
/e/OS - e Foundation - deGoogled unGoogled smartphone operating systems and online services - your data is your data

short: /e/os is based on android.

but other point, which is usage philosophy.

average normie androids store almost everything in a cloud. and many cloud services have poor privacy. /e/os fixes privacy issues, but still uses cloud for storing and syncing. does everything need to be stored on a cloud. point is, users should think about usage philosophy, does user use cloud or local storage and services. i prefer local options and it should be the case for most things.

zetabeta:

maybe i should add, no android based either.

If this is your requirement, then a Linux phone is the only current option that I am aware of. SailfishOS is one example.

link_counts.title: Sailfish OS fifth generation - Sailfish OS

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
zetabeta:

short: /e/os is based on android.

so is graphene.
the mobile OSes that exist currently are iOS, Android (open source Android or proprietary Android), variations on a theme that are Linux Mobile, and Harmony OS. if you restrict yourself to open source then you only have the libre Android ones and one of the Linux Mobile OSes.
